Purpose and scope

This procedure defines how meals are planned, produced, portioned, handed over and recorded. It must be read by all employees of the Community Kitchen and is available to volunteers for information.

Responsibilities

Cooks are responsible for executing meal production and for the accuracy of production data. Volunteers may assist with cutting vegetables, cooking, portioning, replenishing and cleaning, only under supervision and strictly following written recipes and instructions. Responsibility always remains with cooks. The Kitchen Manager provides operational oversight and validation. The Operations Manager holds overall accountability.

Important to know

  • Only written and approved recipes recorded in the system may be used.
  • New recipes or recipe updates must be created or updated using the Recipe Form App by the Kitchen Manager or Operations Manager before they can be used in production.
  • Each production for a given customer, date and dietary category must be fully traceable to:
    • a cook responsible for the production,
    • a specific recipe with the actual list of ingredients and quantities used,
    • declared allergens,
    • recorded core temperature prior to portioning,
    • a system-generated batch number.
  • All the above information must appear on the production report.
  • If the Meal Production App is not available, the production report must be created manually and the customer must be notified.
  • Selected recipes, ingredients and quantities must be followed unless ingredients are unavailable and substitutions are recorded.
  • Production must deliver exactly the number of portions requested per dietary category.
  • Avoid food waste and unnecessary leftovers; use leftovers first when suitable.
  • Apply the First In, First Out (FIFO) principle for ingredients and leftovers.
  • Volunteers are never autonomous; tasks must be demonstrated and supervised.
  • Separate utensils must be used for each dietary pot to prevent cross-contamination.
  • Production is complete only when all requested portions are delivered and the production report is sent.

DO / DO NOT

Do

  • Wash hands regularly with soap and before/after using phones or tablets.
  • Use designated handwash sinks for handwashing only.
  • Wear clean apron, head covering and clean shoes.
  • Minimise time food stays at room temperature.
  • Report illness immediately before handling food.
  • Report any signs of pests immediately.
  • Ensure production data is complete and traceable, including batch number.
  • Create a manual production report if the Meal Production App is unavailable and notify the customer.

Do not

  • Use recipes that are not recorded and approved in the system.
  • Allow volunteers to work without supervision.
  • Use same utensils for different dietary pots.
  • Eat in kitchen or portioning area.
  • Handle food when sick or with uncovered wounds.
  • Wear jewellery while handling food.
  • Leave food at room temperature unnecessarily.
  • Leave production incomplete or unreported.
  • Leave kitchen dirty for next shift.
